representedOrganization.name: MinuteClinic Diagnostic of Rhode Island, LLC
MinuteClinic Diagnostic of Rhode Island, LLC

tr.td: Take 1 lozenge by mouth every 4 (four) hours as needed for sore throat for up to 2 days.
Acute pharyngitis (Primary Dx); Need for immunization against influenza

item.content: INFLUENZA (IM) PRESERVATIVE FREE Abbott Laboratories 0.5 mL
Influenza PF:: INFLUENZA (IM) PRESERVATIVE FREE 33332001401 Dose=0.5 mL Lot# 65487, Abbott Laboratories, Left deltoid, Intramuscular, Expiration Date=05-01-16

item.caption: plan
item.paragraph:
Seek immediate emergency medical attention: Seek immediate emergency medical attention for changes in vision, eye pain, sensitivity to light, increased drainage, difficulty swallowing, stiff neck, shortness of breath, coughing up blood, chest pain or increased fever.
If your symptoms do not improve within 3-4 days: If your symptoms do not improve within 3-4 days, follow up with your primary care provider.
Follow up with primary care provider: Follow up with primary care provider for re-evaluation of persistent symptoms after negative mono test at MinuteClinic.
Seek immediate emergency medical attention: Seek immediate emergency medical attention for changes in vision, eye pain, sensitivity to light, increased drainage, difficulty swallowing, stiff neck, shortness of breath, coughing up blood, chest pain or increased fever.
For your safety, please remain in the clinic area for 15 minutes after receiving your vaccination. Notify the provider immediately if you experience difficulty breathing, weakness, hoarseness or wheezing, fast heartbeat, hives, dizziness, paleness, or swelling of the throat.

td.paragraph: Results for this procedure are in the results section.

tr.td: AFLURIA TIV IM; WITHOUT PRESERVATIVE (9+ YEARS)

code.displayName: AFLURIA TIV IM; WITHOUT PRESERVATIVE (9+ YEARS)
Relevant Diagnostics Tests and/or Laboratory Data

item.caption: POCT Rapid strep A (Fri Feb 20, 2015 3:05 PM EST)
Smith, Cheryl, NP - Fri Feb 20, 2015 3:00 PM EST
item.paragraph:
Subjective:
Patient ID: Samuel Jackson is a 17 y.o. male.
HPI
Sore Throat
described as aching and sore. The level of severity is moderate. Onset was gradual. This problem has existed for 4 days. This problem occurs constantly. Since onset, the problem has been gradually worsening. The problem is new. Symptoms are relieved by gargle. Symptoms are worsened by coughing and talking. Ineffective treatment includes acetaminophen. Associated symptoms include postnasal drip and swollen glands. Negative for ear pain. Risk factors include exposure to illness.
ROS
Negative for: Constitutional, Gastrointestinal, Neurological, Skin, Genitourinary, Musculoskeletal, HENT, Endocrine, Cardiovascular, Eyes, Respiratory, Psychiatric, Allergic/Imm, Heme/Lymph
Objective:
Physical Exam
Constitutional: He appears well-developed and well-nourished.
HENT:
Right Ear: External ear normal.
Left Ear: External ear normal.
Mouth/Throat: Oropharynx is clear and moist.
Eyes: Conjunctivae are normal.
Neck: Normal range of motion.
Cardiovascular: Normal rate, regular rhythm and normal heart sounds.
Pulmonary/Chest: Effort normal and breath sounds normal.
Assessment/Plan:
Exposure to strep at school function. May be allergies or viral.
